description: This dashboard works with postgres_exporter for prometheus

panels.title: General Counters, CPU, Memory and File Descriptor Stats

panels.description: Busy state of all CPU cores together
panels.title: CPU Busy

panels.description: start time of the process
panels.title: Start Time

panels.description: Average user and system CPU time spent in seconds.
panels.title: Average CPU Usage

panels.description: Virtual and Resident memory size in bytes, averages over 5 min interval
panels.title: Average Memory Usage

panels.description: Basic network info per interface
panels.title: Network Traffic Basic

panels.description: pg_settings_max_files_per_process
panels.title: pg_settings_max_files_per_process

panels.description: pg_settings_ssl
panels.title: pg_settings_ssl

panels.description: # HELP pg_settings_track_activity_query_size Sets the size reserved for pg_stat_activity.query, in bytes.
panels.title: pg_settings_track_activity_query_size

panels.description: HELP pg_settings_track_commit_timestamp Collects transaction commit time.
panels.title: pg_settings_track_commit_timestamp

panels.description: HELP pg_settings_track_counts Collects statistics on database activity.
panels.title: pg_settings_track_counts

panels.description: HELP pg_settings_commit_delay Sets the delay in microseconds between transaction commit and flushing WAL to disk.
panels.title: pg_settings_commit_delay

panels.description: pg_settings_checkpoint_warning_seconds
panels.title: pg_settings_checkpoint_warning_seconds

panels.description: pg_settings_deadlock_timeout_seconds
panels.title: pg_settings_deadlock_timeout_seconds

panels.description: # HELP pg_settings_effective_io_concurrency Number of simultaneous requests that can be handled efficiently by the disk subsystem.
panels.title: pg_settings_effective_io_concurrency

panels.description: # HELP pg_settings_idle_in_transaction_session_timeout_seconds Sets the maximum allowed duration of any idling transaction. [Units converted to seconds.]
panels.title: pg_settings_idle_in_transaction_session_timeout_seconds

panels.description: # HELP pg_settings_maintenance_work_mem_bytes Sets the maximum memory to be used for maintenance operations. [Units converted to bytes.]
panels.title: pg_settings_maintenance_work_mem_in_GB
Max duration in seconds any active transaction has been running

panels.description: Total amount of data written to temporary files by queries in this database. All temporary files are counted, regardless of why the temporary file was created, and regardless of the log_temp_files setting.
panels.title: Temp File (Bytes)

panels.description: go_memstats_heap_objects
panels.title: go_memstats_heap_objects

panels.description: # HELP process_max_fds Maximum number of open file descriptors.
panels.title: process_max_fds

panels.description: HELP process_cpu_seconds_total Total user and system CPU time spent in seconds.
panels.title: process_cpu_seconds_total

panels.description: HELP process_open_fds Number of open file descriptors.
panels.title: process_open_fds

panels.description: # HELP process_resident_memory_bytes Resident memory size in Mega bytes.
panels.title: process_resident_memory_in_MB

panels.description: HELP process_start_time_seconds Start time of the process since unix epoch in seconds.
panels.title: process_start_time_days

panels.description: HELP process_virtual_memory_bytes Virtual memory size in Mega bytes.
panels.title: process_virtual_memory_megabytes

panels.description: HELP pg_stat_database_numbackends Number of backends currently connected to this database. This is the only column in this view that returns a value reflecting current state; all other columns return the accumulated values since the last reset.
panels.title: pg_stat_database_numbackends

panels.description: Number of open file descriptors
panels.title: Open File Descriptors

panels.description: HELP pg_stat_activity_count number of connections in this state
panels.title: pg_stat_activity_count

panels.description: # HELP pg_stat_database_blk_read_time Time spent reading data file blocks by backends in this database, in milliseconds
panels.title: pg_stat_database_blk_read_time

panels.description: HELP pg_stat_database_conflicts Number of queries canceled due to conflicts with recovery in this database. (Conflicts occur only on standby servers; see pg_stat_database_conflicts for details.)
panels.title: pg_stat_database_conflicts

panels.description: HELP pg_stat_database_conflicts_confl_deadlock Number of queries in this database that have been canceled due to deadlocks
panels.title: pg_stat_database_conflicts_confl_deadlock

panels.description: HELP pg_stat_database_conflicts_confl_tablespace Number of queries in this database that have been canceled due to dropped tablespaces
panels.title: pg_stat_database_conflicts_confl_tablespace

panels.description: HELP pg_stat_database_temp_files Number of temporary files created by queries in this database. All temporary files are counted, regardless of why the temporary file was created (e.g., sorting or hashing), and regardless of the log_temp_files setting.
panels.title: pg_stat_database_temp_files

panels.description: HELP pg_stat_database_numbackends Number of backends currently connected to this database. This is the only column in this view that returns a value reflecting current state; all other columns return the accumulated values since the last reset.
panels.title: pg_stat_database_numbackends

panels.description: HELP process_virtual_memory_max_bytes Maximum amount of virtual memory available in bytes.
panels.title: process_virtual_memory_max_bytes

panels.description: pg_stat_database_tup_deleted
panels.title: pg_stat_database_tup_deleted

panels.description: # HELP pg_stat_database_numbackends Number of backends currently connected to this database. This is the only column in this view that returns a value reflecting current state; all other columns return the accumulated values since the last reset.
panels.title: pg_stat_database_numbackends

targets.legendFormat: write_time - Total amount of time that has been spent in the portion of checkpoint processing where files are written to disk.
sync_time - Total amount of time that has been spent in the portion of checkpoint processing where files are synchronized to disk.

title: DBA - PostgreSQL Database
